results.title: Running water: landform evolution
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Recognizes the roles human activity can play in itensifying or reducing flood danger. Looks at how rivers cut into landscapes to produce wonders like the Grand Canyon and the formation of deltas and lakes where water and sediment is collected. This episode also looks at how geologists and engineers are tackling the problem of accumulation of silt and sediment in the Mississippi River where three rivers in the delta region are converging.

results.title: Running water: erosion & deposition
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “Earth revealed”.
What do rivers do? The power or velocity of river flow is responsible for some of the most unique sculpting of landforms on the planet. Running water transports sediments and deposits it at river mouths and deltas as well as abrasively smoothing and wearing away bedrock on its course. Geologists study the ways rivers flow and meander in order to solve problems of flooding and silting as well as assiting engineers in the construction of dams and dykes in order to improve flow of water.

results.title: Running water
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
Managing the rivers will be an important part of managing global climate changes. Using satellite technologies, this program visits the great river basins of the planet - the Nile, Amazon, Mississippi, Ganges, Danube and the Yellow River. These mighty watercourses have a profound influence on the people who conduct their daily life along their banks.

results.title: Running to stand still
results.brief_description: Adrian Bush tells the story of how, after spending most of his life on the move, he found friendship and a sense of belonging playing street soccer in Fitzroy, Melbourne, with others from the Big Issue team. Adrian was selected for the Australian street soccer team, which toured internationally, and appeared in an ABC documentary. His experiences with the Big Issue and street soccer have transformed Adrian’s life.

results.title: Running time
results.creator_credit: George Pearson, Colin Low, Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Mort Ransen
results.brief_description: This feature film is an exotic romp through the ‘60s in song and dance. A fantasy that pokes fun not only at some hallowed institutions but at itself as well. The friendship between an old lady and a young man sets off a chain of events that involves a number of well-intentioned middle-aged individuals in some outrageously bizarre situations. A parodic exposition of 1960’s social mores. While the film benefits from its elaborate arsenal of experimental cinematic techniques - split screen images, freeze frames, solarisation and multiple exposures, rapid edits - the narrative is disrupted by a succession of musical numbers. Unlike to so much else in the film, the music and acting styles are somewhat conventional, and detract from what might otherwise be the Canadian counterpart to Vera Chytilova’s “Daisies”.

results.title: Running out of time
results.creator_credit: Milky Way Image and Johnnie To
results.brief_description: A tenacious cop pursues a jewel thief with 72 hours to live who decides to pull off one last heist. In what has become a generic convention of the Hong Kong action film, the two develop a sense of empathy and mutual respect as they engage in a series of mind games that become increasingly complicated as the narrative moves towards a final showdown. With its sparse dialogue and moody, cool cinematography, the film is markedly restrained compared to To’s earlier work. Cast includes Andy Lau and Lau Ching-Wan. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Running out of patience
results.brief_description: In October 1986, Victorian nurses began an historic strike action which was to last 50 days. This video is the nurses version of the dispute. Despite widespread condemnation mainly from the media, the nurses eventually won out for an appropriate career structure including significant pay increases. Actual strike footage together with nursing training films and old photographs explore vocational stereotypes and place the strike in the context of the current crisis in the health care system.

results.title: Running on empty
results.creator_credit: Lorimar Film Entertainment, Amy Robinson, Griffin Dunne and Sidney Lumet
results.brief_description: An absorbing film about a pair of anti-Vietnam activists (Judd Hirsch and Christine Lahti) who have been in hiding from the FBI for over fifteen years. Still committed to their radical ideals, the couple have to face a crisis of conscience when their talented oldest son (River Phoenix) begins to dream about attending music college and leaving behind his life on the run. This under-rated film is an extremely clear-headed portrayal of how the the politics of the Vietnam era still affects the social relationships of contemporary America. One of the most remarkable features of this film is the compassionate tone it extends across the generations. This complex and intelligent film is a film that refuses the easy revisionist moralism of Kasdan’s “The Big Chill”. Made in a decade notable for computer generated whimsy, this very adult Hollywood film is a treasure.

results.title: Running on empty
results.creator_credit: Film Corporation of Western Australia, Pom Oliver, Mark Egerton and John Clark
results.brief_description: A young man, Mike, has an obsession with cars and someone else’s girlfriend. The film concentrates on his struggle to win her, and survive the challenge of her mean boyfriend to a series of illegal street races. Cast includes Deborah Conway, Max Cullen and Richard Moir.
